channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car park lights, 17th July
item.description:
Light are not working at Roman Square WF177 WF176 WF178 WF179
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roman Square, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping again!, 17th July
item.description:
Another truck load of rubbish dumped outside these bins again. Needs to be removed again. This is just an ongoing problem. You need CCTV, catch these illegal fly tippers and fine them, money would be welcomed by Southwark Council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oakfield Road SE20 8QA outside number 17 (Oak, 17th July
item.description:
Oakfield Road SE20 8QA outside number 17 (Oaks Park Medical Centre) there is a Keep Right board (fluorescent yellow with blue disc with white arrow inside disc) which has been graffiti tagged – certainly on rear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Decomposing animal, 17th July
item.description:
A dead fox was reported around 15.20 and has not yet been collected. It is currently decomposing on the pavement and surrounded by flies. It is unusually hot out and this is attracting vermin and is a main high street/pavement with heavy foot fall from pedestrains, children and other dogs. Please can it be removed as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cooper Close, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bench attracting noise and litter, 17th July
item.description:
Newly installed bench is attracting anti social behaviour and littering of alcohol bottles. Almost every night people sit there in groups or alone or on twos drunk and talking loudly. It’s becoming a spot to congregate. Please remove this bench.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oakfield Road around 10 yards or so fr, 17th July
item.description:
Oakfield Road around 10 yards or so from streetlight column ID 8 are large green boxes – tagged. (Diagonally opposite Limes Ave junction.)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parked on trading estate, 17th July
item.description:
There are a few cars that park here illegally, they should not be using the trading estate as a car park, the cars belong to the flats of Beamish House. They bring their children in the mornings on the school run, leaving their cars parked overnight and feel that they can park here. Can they be given a parking ticket to deter them from parking here? I'm at my wits end, those is a business park not an free overnight parking spot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Raymouth Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 outside number 92 is, 17th July
item.description:
Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 outside number 92 is a letterbox which has been graffiti tagged. (I assume you deal with these but if not please give me contact details for Royal Mail.)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 20+ bags rubbish dumped outside 2a Lawrence Buildings, 17th July
item.description:
Please collect the 15-20 bags of rubbish dumped outside 2a Lawrence Buildings at junction of Garnham Street and Lawrence Buildings. Thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garnham Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp post has no street lighting, not working, 17th July
item.description:
Lamp post has no street lighting working next to 45 myra street, also lamp post needs dog fowling sign attached as always deposit left daily by dog owners not picking up. Very unpleasant when walking up street with family.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Myra Street, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: High Street (Penge) SE20 number 15 – 17 –, 17th July
item.description:
High Street (Penge) SE20 number 15 – 17 – two window sills under windows / bricked up corner window facing Crampton Road graffiti tagged – Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4179323,-0.0593049,3a,75y,77.05h,83.84t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1s3Yc8uiZ6TZ7fmF0pSIwGMQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D6.1629055595954725%26panoid%3D3Yc8uiZ6TZ7fmF0pSIwGMQ%26yaw%3D77.04729773581764!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDcxNS4xIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

item.title: Very bright streetlight, 17th July
item.description:
Since the installation of the new lights, the bedrooms towards the street are not being able to black out all the lights anymore. Even though they use blackout curtains. Is there a way to install a guard towards the building on 18-24 Warwick way (Tesco) that the light does not directly shine into the apartments?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Warwick Way, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Our street cleaner keeps dumping their rubbish bag at our crossroads when it is almost a week until next rubbish collection therefore causing mess and encouraging littering!!, 17th July
item.description:
Once again the street cleaner has dumped bags of rubbish on the street. Please ask them to put the rubbish they have swept up in a bin in the estate nearby (or even someone’s personal wheelie bin) instead of dumping it in the street!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Anerley Hill SE19 a few yards south of property 2A, 17th July
item.description:
Anerley Hill SE19 a few yards south of property 2A (aka Giant / Liv cycle store) is a bus stop – the bus stop flag post has the letter F on top of it. On the opposite side of the road to this bus stop flag is a green footpath box which is graffiti tagged. Google Streetview of box: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4198458,-0.0774964,3a,75y,2.73h,93.13t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1s0d4Njh3fveCSKsLNmqLpAA!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D-3.1345973696645473%26panoid%3D0d4Njh3fveCSKsLNmqLpAA%26yaw%3D2.728740424661835!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDcxNS4xIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2a, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
